title: I find that I'm able to effectively study better late at night rather than early morning. I'm not talking about cramming but rather just studying in general. Is that bad for me? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm exactly the same. I think it simply comes down to taking advantage of whatever time you feel most focused. I watch the TV at the end of my bed from 6 am after I first awaken and its several minutes before I can even understand the news captions running along the bottom of the screen so I dont bother trying. By 10am I'm fairly coherent but I wouldn't describe myself a being sharp as a tack until around 8 pm in the evening when I can produce my best work. I dont see how responding to your own inner clock can be bad for you although I have found I was going to bed later and later at night and I had to correct that. I don't think that behavior is good for anyone.
No mate. That is absolutely fine. Some are comfortable in STUDYING at night and some in the morning. So go ahead. Study well.
